reviewText: This is a wonderful concert ffilm of Sade Adu in concert (it says in Sept. 2001-wonder if it's before or after the day of infamy?). This is an example of true talent and class. Sade sings rather well and her band (particularly her backup singers and her saxophonist) excellently compliment her talents and enhance an already good show. The likes of Khia and Little Kim could learn a lot from Sade on how to be a sensual LADY on stage without compromising your dignity. Sade certainly looks as lovely as she sounds, but carries herself in a manner on stage that would not embarrass your kids, parents, or a date. You go, girl! A worthwhile purchase for a good date or a relaxing evening after work.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Anyone who loves that classic sound of Sade should also love this DVD. Never in-your-face and always smooth, Sade transports you to another world. Great but classic entertainment. These songs and performances will still be played long after Sade is gone. Sometimes I just turn on the CD player and listen to the live tunes when I'm cleaning up. Sade graces this DVD with behind-the-scenes footage of both her and her band mates, a few clips of India.Arie (her opening act) and special tributes from her fans (whom all seem to adore her), a video and pictures. Definitely well worth the money. A classic production. Believe me, you won't be disappointed with this one.  - Donna.

reviewText: Less angular than in her younger days, Sade's face has aquired a careworn beauty that is just breathtaking!  She may wear her heart on her sleeve, but she also proves that an "older (wo)man is like an elegant wine."  This concert tour, her first in nearly a decade, finds a performer who needs no pyrotechnics or aerobic stage choreography to put on a great show! In fact, the simplest touches (i.e., lighting effects, a vocal florish from a backup singer, or an instrumental accent) are among the best moments, and she repeatedly shows that she can actually rock the house and bring the crowd to its feet.  Her versions of "Cherish the Day," "Kiss of Life," "Somebody Already Broke My Heart," "No Ordinary Love" and "Lover's Rock" are moving, pulsating anthems that both celebrate and mourn the enduring, frustrating power and pain of love.  Her surprising performances of "Sweetest Taboo," and "Paradise," in which she and her excellent male backup singers perform sexy dance interludes, give much credence to the adage that "less is more."  On record, "Is it a Crime" is a slow-burning, moody, jazzy tale of unrequited love--a song I never imagined would be a good choice to include in a live concert.  However, Sade's electrifying delivery of this song (replete with sensational electric guitar and saxophone solos) is a MAJOR highlight!  This CD is definitely a MUST-HAVE for fans of Sade. . .
Title: N/A

reviewText: Prior to this, i have not actually watched a full Sade concert on video. I have been a fan for a while and was very surprised to see this live concert in superb aural and visual clarity.The wild fans cheer with each Sade number, and not to mention how great this 40-ish soul bird looks in that Chinese cheongsam. She's hot. what's even hotter are the songs. From the breathtaking 1st number Cherish The Day to oldies such as Smooth Operator and Jezebel and newer stuff suchn as By Your Side, you know you havent heard anything like this yet. the old songs take on a new dimension, making them as relevant as they were 15 years back. Sade sounds terribly soulful and her stage charm is irresistable. She doesn't say much but her lo-tech-hi-style show promises to be fun too especially when Sade take to the floor and dances quite admirably. Something i didn't quite expect of her and the fact that she pulls it off with so much grace is definitely worth watching this show.Her costume change next brings on her funkier edge, where she performs the very funky Flow from Lovers Rock. The rock rocked every part of it. Her backup singers and band are pretty cool too, sychronizing with her seamlessly on each number.If you havent had the chance to see this lady in person, see her on this cool DVD/video.

reviewText: This DVD is among my favorites and I enjoy a wide range of musical styles. Sade and the band performed flawlessly and the mix is tremendous. The arrangements are precise and the performance extremely powerful with an amazing amount of air underneath. This is very conducive of Sade's style and what we love about her. She is lovely and sings like an angel. A  must have DVD.

reviewText: This is an excellent substitute for not actually seeing the concert. I would recommend purchasing, especially if you've already seen her live and want something to remember the experience by. It's also a nice addition to your Sade collection even if you have all the previous releases with the songs on them.The cinemetography could have been better in the shots of "Sade Walking", and "The Band Walking" extras.I was really disappointed in the advertised "FREE ART PRINT". I was expecting something suitable for framing, like a poster that could be folded out and framed in a poster frame but it's just a little cardboard insert tucked inside the left frontside of the dvd cover. Very disappointed!!!!!!However, the dvd content is excellent and I especially like the "king of sorrow" video. It really makes Sade seem real and down to earth. She does a good job in the video. I'm really surprised she hasn't tried her hand at an acting career. She is absolutely photogenic and a great look. Sade is a refreshing face with a different more ethnically diverse look than the typical hollywood starlet.
summary: If you see the concert get this.

reviewText: Sade` s tender and gentle voice who has known to occupy a special in the taste of a music that might be regarded between the soft ballad and the smooth jazz. This memorable recital includes several high moments like the tracks "Be your side" It's a crime" "Cherry pie", "Every word", "Kiss of life."Her unenviable charisma, seductive voice join with a smooth style that really captivates, conveys and engages the most exigent spectator. An album that becomes worthy to acquire as soon as you can. By my side, I have brought three times, one for me and the other two as special gifts for selected friendsSo, don't miss this album. It will amaze you from start to finish.

reviewText: Lovers Live is an excellent showcase of the simple perfection of Sade's music.  There is no elaborate light show or over produced theatrics, just Sade's rich vocals backed by a fantastic band, and a stellar setlist focusing on her "Lovers Rock" album.  I purchased the DVD after seeing a few of the Lovers Live performances on YouTube and was amazed at how perfect she sounds live.  I typically purchase live albums/DVD's based solely on the setlist, but after seeing the videos online it was not as important as enjoying Sade and her music as a whole.  However, as I mentioned above, the setlist is perfect, touching on the best tracks from Lovers Rock and fan favorites.  Highlights (for me) include King Of Sorrow, Every Word, Sweetest Taboo, and Paradise.
summary: An excellent live DVD for any fan of music, not just of Sade
Title: N/A

reviewText: Sade is as enchanting as ever in this excellent follow-up to the first concert DVD ("Sade Live").  This performance, which was filmed in September of 2001 at two SoCal venues, proves that after eight years, the attraction of Sade herself is just as strong as her music.At just under two hours, you get a comprehensive show:  22 songs, with ten from the latest "Lovers Rock" CD.  The remaining twelve are all favorite hits from Sade's previous four albums.  Sound-wise, everything sounds great, and you can select from either stereo or 5.1 Surround Sound to suit your tastes.  The band plays really tight, and there are some nice surprises, such as a cool intro to "Sweetest Taboo" and a funky/rock version of "Paradise" (check out the choreography).Visually, you see lots of Sade (a good thing), yet the camera time spent on her and the rest of the band is fairly balanced.  I loved the editing since I was watching what I wanted to see pretty much most of the time.  The lighting for this tour is somewhat more interesting than the last, and the use of the video screen in back of the stage adds some pizzazz, especially the film of water dropping in synch with key accented beats in "Somebody Already Broke My Heart."  The camera work and editing are superb.  Even the credit track is awesome, with some really touching footage of the audience.DVD Extras:  1) behind-the-scenes video (pretty funny) of the band members dancing and mugging for the camera; 2) Sade, behind-the-scenes; 3) concertgoers' "messages to Sade"; and 4) excellent "King of Sorrow" video, directed by Sophie Muller and filmed in Puerto Rico.
Title: N/A

reviewText: There is something about Sade that gives her the distinctive edge over other Divas.  Her song soothes and relaxes but doesn't lull you to sleep; grabs you but doesn't overwhelm.  It's subtle, sensual, and instinctive.  When you are used to listening to Sade for years and see her live in this concert, the combined audio and visual effect is electric.  The sweetest taboo, By Your side, No Ordinary Love, Is it a Crime are quintessentially Sade's - it's hard to imagine anybody else.

reviewText: This one is a must-get for Sade fans ... her voice, poise, charm, grace and singing voice are terrific as always, and the "Paradise" mix is one I watch over and again...Hearing the crowd chant "go Sade, go Sade" and her reaction is nice to watch ...  it's definitely worth getting if you like Sade.  Classy, well done.

reviewText: FOR A BETTER VALUE, GET THE LOVERS ROCK/LOVERS LIVE CD INSTEAD.This DVD is sold in many different ways.  Here it is sold as the DVD alone.  For the same price, you can buy Lovers Rock, which contains a copy of this DVD as a bonus (it comes in a standard CD jewel case).  You can also buy the Lovers Live/Lovers Rock which is the same thing, but comes in a standard DVD box and costs slightly more.  Or, there is an audio CD version of Lovers Live, but it is only a single CD, 78 minutes long and does not have all the songs that the DVD has.  Confused yet?This is one of the best filmed and edited concert DVDs to come out in the last few years.  Most concert DVDs are filmed with inadequate lighting and with bad camera angles.  The editing can be especially bad, with the scenes constantly flipping, the cameras always zooming in and out, and the wrong person being shown at the wrong time.The filming and lighting of this DVD is extremely good.  The camera angles and close ups are great.  The editing is fairly good, but not as good as some classics, like Stop Making Sense.  For the most part, the scene focuses on the correct musician at the correct time.  The shots are held for more than 2 seconds.  There still is a little too much flipping around in some parts, like during the encore.  The shot never holds long enough for you to get a clear picture of the new outfit and hairdo Sade has just changed into.The extras on this DVD are not very significant.  There are shots of Sade and the band walking from backstage up to the stage.  And then there is a section of inane interviews of fans.This is the concert tour to support Sade's Lovers Rock CD.  So, there are many songs from that album.  Much of the music at this concert is played in the style of Lovers Rock, even most of her old classic songs.I prefer Sade's original sound to what she is doing today.  It is a subtle change, but I don't think the new sound makes the best of her voice and talents.  On the classic songs, I have heard Sade do them better in the past.The sound is a starker, muted sound backed by a rhythm that almost sounds like an electronic drum machine.  Her vocals are whispered in popish way.  I prefer the old days where she a lusher, but more jazz oriented sound.  However, I also like a couple of the new tracks on Lovers Rock that are blues oriented.For anyone who loves Sade, especially her more recent sound, this is a fantastic concert DVD.  You couldn't ask for more.
summary: One of the better filmed and edited concert DVD's

reviewText: Just like another poster after listening to the cd audience I wanted to see what they were so excited about. Again Sade shows and proves. I saw her live years ago and it was a terrific experience. I like this DVD better than the first one. Perhaps with age, birth of a child and wisdom, Sade is just mesmerizing. I wish I could be so smooth and move as gracefully as she does in daily life. Her dance movements are just so classy and elegant yet sexy as they come. Of course, Sweetback is outstanding as expected.This one should be in your collection. I am either watching it once a month and defintely keep the CD close by at all times.
summary: The CD is what got me

reviewText: I was very impressed with the DVD, "Lovers Live" by the incomparable Sade. Sade and her bandmates performed all of their greatest hits as well as material from her latest album, "Lovers Rock." Sade never fails to disappoint, and this was my first opportunity to see her sing live. Her voice is just as velvety smooth as it is on her CDs! Along with the almost two hours of concert footage, there are also some behind-the-scenes moments that people in the audience never got to see.I would highly suggest this DVD to any fan of Sade, but I would also suggest it to people who have a great love of incredible music and would like to just sit back, relax, and enjoy one of the greatest bands, and singers, in the world!!! You will not be disappointed!!!!

reviewText: Before I say anything else I have to point out one reviewer's ridiculous comment that Sade's clothing looks like a school marm's. So a woman can't wear a tasteful dress with splits on the sides and a ruffled blouse with a pair of slimming black pants and still be sexy? Sade is a grown woman and although she doesn't wear the midriff bearing dress from 1994's Sade Live, she's still jaw droppingly gorgeous as ever. Check out some other concerts if you want practically bare body parts and leave Ms. Adu to the grown and sexy. Ok?Can you handle 2 hours of The Lady and her men? If so, pick this dvd up! Sade's voice is captivating as always, the band's playing and Leroy's backup vocals are on point, and the colors of the set are eye catching. An improvement over Sade Live is that Lovers Live includes shots of audience members grooving and singing along to the music. The clip of two lovers gently swaying to Kiss of Life while holding each other is beautiful. The bonus material includes backstage footage of Sade and the boys getting ready for the show, shout outs from fans, black and white stills of the concert, and the King of Sorrow video directed by Sophie Muller (who also shot the concert). Kick back and enjoy.
Title: N/A

reviewText: They pushed the release date of this DVD back a few times, but now it's out and it was worth the wait.  The show is one of the best live shows there is, which is the reason to get this.  You want to be able to pop straight to the songs you like in the future easily, and DVD was made for that.The extra features are cute, but not overwhelming: a photo gallery, some short backstage footage (but soundtracked with music, not real-time ambience or talking), the video for "King of Sorrow", 5:1 sound optional.  Good stuff, but no reason to buy it over video except for the ability to dance around the show at will, which for me is enough.  The intro menu is a bit slow because it's fancy and animated, but you won't be on it too often anyway.

reviewText: Sophie Muller did a terrific job shooting the last concert video "SADE LIVE," but really tops it off with the latest "Lovers Live" dvd/video.  It is beautifully shot, and every move SADE makes is stunning and sexy. Smooth Operator where the cover shot comes from is one of the highlights of the show.  The band is also a great force behind this excellent concert as you can see by watching the instrumental jam Red Eye.Excellent DVD and the price is right.
summary: One of this year's best concert videos!
